SEARCH
Module JBubbleBobble
Package game.controller

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
game.controller.Controller
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class Controller extends Object implements Runnable
The Controller class Controller is responsible for managing the game loop and state transitions. It handles the game's main logic, including updating the game state, rendering, and managing different game states. This class implements the Runnable interface to allow the game loop to run on a separate thread.

  • Constructor Details

    • Controller

      public Controller()
      Constructs a new Controller instance. Initializes game states, view, model, and game frame. Displays the menu screen by default.

  • Method Details

      public GameFrame getGameFrame()
      Gets the GameFrame associated with this Controller.
      Returns:
      the GameFrame

    • startGameLoop

      public void startGameLoop()
      Starts the game loop. Initializes and starts the game thread, and transitions to the game screen.

    • stopGameLoop

      public void stopGameLoop()
      Stops the game loop and waits for the game thread to finish execution.

    • resetGame

      public void resetGame()
      Resets the game to its initial state. Reloads the model and transitions to the menu screen.

    • update

      private void update()
      Updates the current game state based on the GameState.

    • run

      public void run()
      The main game loop executed on a separate thread. Handles the timing of updates and rendering.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
